meanings.definition: A condition marked by a deficiency of red blood cells or of hemoglobin in the blood, resulting in pallor and weariness.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed her with anemias after noticing her pale skin and constant tiredness.
meanings.sent2: The anemias made her feel weak and tired all the time.
meanings.sent3: Despite her best efforts, her anemias seemed to turn her into a sleepy ghost.
meanings.sent4: The anemias drained her energy like a vampire sucking blood.
meanings.sent5: The anemias left her looking as pale as a ghost and feeling as tired as a marathon runner at the finish line.

meanings.definition: A lack of vitality or spirit.
meanings.sent1: His constant boredom and lack of enthusiasm indicated a case of anemias in his spirit.
meanings.sent2: The anemias in her spirit made her lose interest in everything she used to enjoy.
meanings.sent3: His anemias of spirit turned him into a couch potato with no motivation.
meanings.sent4: The anemias in her spirit were like a dark cloud overshadowing her usual spark.
meanings.sent5: The anemias of spirit sucked the joy out of his life, leaving him feeling empty and uninspired.
